evidence.text: Person A: Maretha! You get up here and get ready to go so you be on time. Ain’t no need you trying to take advantage of company.

Person A: Now I lay me down to sleep, I pray the lord my soul to keep. If I should die before I wake, I pray the Lord my soul to take.
Person B: Who is it?

Person A: Maretha, you go on and get ready for me to do your hair. Go on.
Person B: Mama, all the hair grease is gone.
Person A: Here...run across the street and get another can. You come straight back, too. Don’t be playing around out there. And watch the cars. Be careful when you cross the street.
Person A: Boy Willie, I done told you to leave my house.
Person A: Girl, stop banging on that piano.
Person A: Well then play it. You got to feel it.
